title: Judge Tosses Criminal Charges Against James Comey and Letitia James
summary: The decision is a setback for the president’s efforts to wield the criminal justice system against his perceived enemies.

title: U.S. and Ukraine Hail Progress on Peace Plan to End War With Russia
summary: Washington and Kyiv said that “highly productive” discussions over a proposal to end the war between Russia and Ukraine would continue.

title: Army Chief Says France Must ‘Accept Losing Our Children,’ Igniting Uproar
summary: The furor erupted as President Emmanuel Macron is expected to present a plan for paid, voluntary military service to bolster the armed forces against the threat from Russia.

title: Trump Is Considering Push to Extend Obamacare Subsidies
summary: President Trump has not made a final decision. But he is under pressure to address the cost of health care, which for many Americans will jump if the subsidies expire.

title: How the Coast Guard Revised Its Policy on Swastikas, Nooses and Bullying
summary: After days of backlash, the Homeland Security Department said hateful and violent behavior would not be tolerated.

title: Xi Presses Trump on Taiwan as They Agree to Meet in China in April
summary: In an unusual move, Xi Jinping, the leader of China, called President Trump. The two spoke about trade, Taiwan and Ukraine, according to separate official statements.

summary: These simple recipes for roast turkey, stuffing, pie crust and more will set you up for a spectacular meal.

title: An Auto Holy Grail: Motors That Don’t Rely on Chinese Rare Earths
summary: Weary of being captive to geopolitics, car companies are looking for ways to replace powerful rare-earth magnets in electric motors.

title: Amid GPS and Ride-Hailing, the Allure of London’s Black Cab Endures
summary: In a world of GPS and car-hailing apps, some Londoners still want to drive a traditional black cab. First, they must memorize thousands of city streets.

title: Venezuelan Diaspora Divided on Trump’s Military Strategy
summary: President Trump’s military actions and immigration policies have divided Venezuelans in South Florida, many of whom fled the Maduro regime.

title: Health Issues in Middle Age Can Be Linked to Pregnancy Years Earlier
summary: Women with common pregnancy complications are at increased risk for cardiovascular and metabolic health problems later in life. But many patients remain unaware of the connection.

title: Sleep Apnea Linked to Parkinson’s Disease, New Study Finds
summary: Those with the sleep condition were more likely to develop Parkinson’s disease. But one treatment was found to help.

title: Ozempic Drug Fails to Quell Alzheimer’s in Novo Nordisk Trials
summary: The studies were a significant setback for the optimistic view that semaglutide and other GLP-1 drugs could help prevent a number of brain diseases.

title: Viola Fletcher, Oldest Survivor of the Tulsa Race Massacre, Dies at 111
summary: At 7, she bore witness to one of American history’s most violent spasms of racial violence. She was 106 when the nation reckoned with the crime.

summary: Married for three decades, the actors get together as characters in the second season of “A Man on the Inside.”

title: In Nebraska, Makeovers for Buildings That Don’t Price Out the Locals
summary: In a struggling area of Lincoln, a program pays for repairs and energy efficiency upgrades in rental buildings. In return, landlords must keep rents affordable.

summary: The move sets up a possible rematch between Mr. Jones, the last Democrat to win statewide office in Alabama, and Tommy Tuberville, the Republican who ousted him from the Senate in 2020.

title: Gaza Humanitarian Foundation Is Closing
summary: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation said it had succeeded in delivering million of meals in the war-torn enclave, but some Palestinians were killed trying to obtain them.
